div.h1:
Huron School District
Completely Committed To Kids!

div.style: position: absolute; left: 0px; top: 0px; z-index: 100001; background-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); opacity: 0.5; display: none;

li.a: Continuity of Learning and COVID-19 Response Plan
Procedures for Determination of Specific Learning Disabilities

div.style: background: white; border: 5px solid black; box-shadow: 0px 0px 10px black; padding:15px 15px 0px 15px;

p.style: padding: 10px; line-height: 1.2; font-size: 20px; font-family: arial; margin-bottom: 10px;

div.p: To help parents and students navigate remote learning options during the school closure, we're introducing the Huron Learning Hub. Using the Hub parents and students will be able to view weekly learning schedules, contact teachers, access Google Classroom, and explore educational content and resources.

p.style: border-top: 5px solid #880606; box-shadow: 0px 0px 10px black; margin-bottom: 10px; text-align: center; margin-top: 0px; padding: 10px 10px 25px 10px; font-size: 36px; background: black; text-transform: uppercase; font-family: Oswald, sans-serif; line-height: 1.2;

p.span: Please read the latest letter from the superintendent covering the district's Continuity of Learning Plan and support information.

hr.p: * For more information and further updates, check the district's blog and follow @HuronSchoolDist on Twitter. Please visit our parent and student resource pages for links to educational resources and some additional information regarding the closure.

Tuesdays and Fridays from 11:00AM to 1:00PM Huron School District is providing meals (breakfast and lunch) to ALL students in the District, 18 years of age and under, free of charge and regardless of Free & Reduced Meal Status. We will also be providing FREE meals to students in our special education community up to age 26. Other food pickup sites can be found at https://www.mcgi.state.mi.us/schoolnutrition/.

div.style: color: white; background: black; padding: 10px; border: 2px solid white; text-align: center; margin-bottom: 10px;

p.span: Thank you Huron family and community members for your support!

a.title: Bond Proposal Letter of Thanks
a.span: Read a letter of thanks from the superintendent and view updates regarding the bond.

div.style: width: 23%; padding: 5px; background: #f1f1f1; color: black; border: 2px solid black; text-align: center;

img.alt: Huron Board Office and High School
img.title: Huron Board Office and High School

div.p: Our vision is to inspire personal growth in every student and to ignite a passion for learning and leadership. For information pertaining to events at each building, please click on their individual sites for detailed information.

div.style: background-image: url('http://huronschools.org/UserFiles/Servers/Server_105709/Image/element5-digital-OyCl7Y4y0Bk-unsplash.jpg');box-shadow: 0px 5px 10px grey; width: 75%; background: white; border: 2px solid black; padding: 10px; margin: 20px auto 20px auto;

p.style: text-decoration: underline; margin-bottom: 20px; line-height: 36px; font-weight: bold; font-size: 36px; margin: 0px; text-align: center;

div.p: Huron School District is a great place for learning. The Huron Township community is one of the last rural areas existing in Wayne County, Michigan. Huron Schools embraces small town values; while providing students with big time educational opportunities. Because of the excellent educational setting, highly desirable schools and outstanding employees, Huron Schools are the “Schools of Choice” in the downriver region.

a.title: About Huron School District
a.span: Learn more about Huron School District.

div.p: A list of events/calendar for the 2019-2020 School year is now available on the district's calendar page. Events will also be posted directly to the district's calendar and available in upcoming events. The print calendar and a PDF of version will be available prior to the start of the school year.

p.style: font-weight: bold; text-align: center; font-size: 24px; line-height: 36px; margin-bottom: 0;
